Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: My hair is a mix of 2C waves and 3A curls. I have a LOT of hair. And I have yet to find an all-in-one product that will shape and define my curls, add moisture without too much grease and prevent frizz. For me, this product was a great all-over first step, but it didn’t accomplish everything on my list.On wash day, I sectioned off my hair (just top and bottom) and applied this product. Then I scrunched to work it in and start to define curls. Diffused until my hair was about half dry, just to see how it was looking. Result was a bit puffier than I would like, and curls weren’t especially well-defined. So I added a small amount of my favorite standby curl definition product, particularly near the ends, and a little bit of an all-over texturizing cream that works really well for me on about the bottom half. Then I diffused it until it was all the way dry.Some observations:* The top of my head, which ONLY had this product applied on it, definitely started off greasier than I would normally like it to be right after a wash. So I think maybe that any product that promises “moisture” like this one perhaps just isn’t well suited to being applied so close to the crown of my head.* The rest of my hair looks good, but it is definitely “wetter” looking than normal.* My hair is touchably soft. Absolutely no crispiness at all. Big thumbs up there.* This product smells AMAZING. Legit like dessert.* A little bit goes a long way. I have a ton of hair and I used maybe the equivalent of three quarter-sized dollops to coat all of it. The jar this comes in is HUGE, so this will last a very long time.I’ve tried a LOT of curl creams, from all over the brand and price spectrum. This product is a solid offering in the curl cream category, without a doubt. And given its price and size, it’s a fantastic value.Overall, I’m really happy with my results after using this product. For me, it wasn’t the be-all, end-all solution I’ve been searching for, but that’s OK. I have some proven standby products that are best used sparingly, anyway, and this product is a great base to start from. Can’t win them all, but this come pretty close!

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: First: This product smells wonderful! It smells like vanilla and pineapple. My husband, who cares little about these things, smelled it and said, “I want to eat some!” So, keep an open container away from children!Second: It says on the container to apply to dry or damp hair and leave it. I did that. My wavy mousy brown hair then looked like it needed a wash very badly. It did not “enhance” my waves or make them more curly like similarly named products that I use to good effect.Third: I got online and saw that it says here to apply to wet hair after shampooing, leave on for three minutes and rinse. Hmm. SheaMoisture, you’ve confused me! Since my hair looked pretty awful, followed these directions. It did a beautiful job as a conditioner; left my hair shiny and soft. Did nothing to “enhance curls,” but I can’t knock it for what it did do.The thing is, it doesn’t do as advertised, but I’m using this instead of my conditioner until I use up the container. Then I might try another of their products for the scent alone.Do I recommend it? If you don’t have a good conditioner and you like the smell of pineapple.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: No longer think and mositerzing as it once was. Formula change.
Review: Shea Moisture sold out! This new formulation is nothing like the orginal.  It thinner and runny. The old formula was so thick that you could hold the container upside down and nothing would fall out.  Now it's a runny soupy meal that's no as heavely moisturizing as it once was. I knew the company jumped shipped when I saw people with non type 4 or 3 hair using it. The older formulation was much too heavy for thinner non kinky curly hair textures.  Shea moisture tried being all inclusive and left out the people that got them to where they are. Also the company is no longer black owned and now uses cheaper ingredients since it's become a corporate entity.  I haven't bought any shea moisture products in years since they sold out their main customer base.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have been looking at this product for so long, so I’m so glad I finally got it. I have regularly somewhat curly hair, but when I don’t use a curly hair product, it is super flat. This product did wonders to my hair!! For one, look at those curls in that photo! And look how cute that curl is on the side. I was shocked! The product itself smells AMAZING. It’s like a coconut and tropical fruit mix. I’m obsessed! The bottle has sooo much product so I don’t think I’ll ever run out (which I’m not complaining!) I put this in my ends and it didn’t feel like it was weighing down my hair! It made my hair feel soft and smooth!

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: SheaMoisture Coconut & Hibiscus Curl Enhancing Smoothie, 12 OunceThis is wonderful for anyone with dry and damaged hair.  You can use it as a leave-in conditioner or apply it to freshly shampooed hair for 3 minutes and rinse out.  The scent is an amazing mix of coconut and pineapple.Ingredients Deionized Water, Butyrospermum Parkii (Shea Butter)*, Cocos Nucifera (Coconut ) Oil*, Macadamia Ternifolia Seed Oil, Magnifera Indica (Mango) Seed Butter*, Persea Gratissima (Avacado) Oil, Vegetable Glycerin, Aloe Barbadensis Leaf Extract, Silk Protein, Ammonium Salt, Melia Azadiratcha (Neem) Seed Oil,Daucus Carota Sativa (Carrot) Seed oil, Sorbitol Esters, Panthenol (Pro-Vitamin B-5), Caprylyl Glycol, Essential Oil Blend, Lonicera Caprifolium (honeysuckle) Flower (and) Lonicera Japonica (Japanese Honeysuckle) Flower Extract, Tocopherol (Vitamin E), Hibiscus Flower Extract *Certified Organic Ingredient.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: TOP 50 REVIEWER
Review: This smoothie is a good alternative to gel for getting juicy, defined curls. The texture is similar to a deep conditioner. It has a coconut-heavy fragrance. You don't need to use much for this to work. I've found that it's better to apply it to damp hair vs wet. This is a great product for braid-outs and twist-outs. I  highly recommend it.Thanks so much for taking the time to read this review. I hope the information that I've provided makes your decision a little easier.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have very thin, but SUPER dry wavy hair and have been still looking for a great product that will help foster that natural curl. I especially have trouble getting my waves to continue at the root. I have heard of this product in curly girl groups and was excited to try it, although the consensus seems to be that this brand is "too heavy" for wavies and thin hair. I didn't have that experience at all. I know personally my hair is extremely dry - I only need to wash once or twice a week and have never had greasy hair in my life. When applying, I trusted my gut and used quite a bit of this product rather than using it sparsely, knowing my hair loves moisture.The results were fantastic. As my hair is actually quite fine and thin, I went for volume and curl formation versus definition and clumping in my wash/dry routine and diffused until completely dry.  I could REALLY tell a difference in the formation of my curls - my hair was more curlier than normal and much more curls at the root. I've used other curl creams and haven't seen this type of results before. The product has no cast or crunchiness - it really makes for soft curls. Mine held great even next-day, but my hair holds pretty well anyway. Others might need a gel or mousse to go with it. Next time I want to try a gel with it so I can see if I get a bit more definition. The product smells great and has a lot of slip. It's really a great product and I do think it lives up to the "curl enhancing" part of the name.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Both my young daughter and I have really long, waist length curly hair so I'm always on the lookout for new curly girl products for us. SheaMoisture is a recognizable, good brand that always offers great products. This was no exception. There's a ton of product that comes in the large tub. Its a fairly thick cream formula that is kind of hard to scoop out with nails on (lol) but not hard to apply. I get a little on my palm and rub my hands together before applying it to slightly moistened hair, section by section. It has a light scent that reminds me of the tropics. Coconut, fruity and floral.Once in the hair and dried, it enhances and preserves our natural curl patterns. I don't need to do any manual twirling or use any curling tools to "make" the curls happen. The hair and curls are bouncy, flexible, tamed with little to no frizz, and not crunchy at all. My daughter's preschool teacher is always saying how pretty her hair is and even stopped me one morning to complement me and tell me how she and her assistant teacher admire our hair.I'm very happy with the performance of this product, and highly recommend it

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: As others have mentioned, there is some inconsistency with regard to using this product- the product jar says to leave the conditioner in and the product page says to rinse. I think this SheaMoisture Coconut & Hibiscus Curl Enhancing Smoothie can be used either way, depending on your hair type. Those with dry hair or those with tighter curls will probably like this better as a leave-in to moisturize and define curls vs those with fine/thin hair that tends to get oily may prefer to rinse it out. I fall into the latter camp. When used in the shower and after rinsing, this lovely smelling conditioner leaves my hair feeling soft and helps to reduce the frizzy flyaways from my long wavy hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: TOP 500 REVIEWER
Review: There are many good things about this cream, but it has an over-powering negative. This cream has a very strong scent. A powerful sweet vanilla scent.  I did not like the scent or the strength of the aroma. I like vanilla scent in general; it was this version of the scent that got to me.On the positive side, I was surprised that the tub was bigger than I expected. It worked well, giving my curls more definition without making them stiff or sticky.However, the scent was a deal-breaker; after putting it on, I had to wash my hair in a couple of hours to get rid of the scent.Ali Julia review

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I've been wanting to try this product for some time, but I wasn't sure it would be right for my curls. I have curly course, dry, frizzy hair, but it's not super thick, so I was worried this would be too much for my hair and would weigh it down.The first time I used it, I used too much, and it did leave a bit of a yucky feel to my hair, but with just the right amount, it's awesome. So, you just have to adjust according to your hair.I do think this is a great product for curly heads (and maybe just for frizzy heads, too). :)  Oh, and the scent is so nice! Sometimes I open the jar just to take a whiff.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Love this stuff!
Review: I've got extremely curly hair that would be classified somewhere between 3B and 3C. Think classic "Jew Fro". I have been growing my hair out since February (9+ months), and it tends to get dry and crispy if I go to long without deep conditioning. Lately I have been trying all sorts of regimens to keep my hair nourished, healthy, and happy. I've tried at least a dozen products, and this shea moisture leave-in product blows everything else clean out of the water. My curls are naturally springy and well formed without that crunchy gel feeling, my hair is dark and shiny, and it smells really nice. No oily residue on my pillow or other surfaces my hair comes into contact with, and I don't have to use a ton, even though my hair does tend to drink up product. Better yet, this is an industrial sized vat that should last me for months to come. I think I've found my go-to long term curl care product! Highly recommended!

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Love this!
Review: This 12 oz tub of curl enhancing smoothie is going to last so long!  I love this brand for both their products and their values.This smells like a tropical beach vacation. The coconut really comes through but not in an offputting or artificial way.  The cream is like a thick lotion and it does not take much at all.  In fact, I made the mistake of using too much one time and it really looked bad so just start with small amounts and slowly add more if needed.This can be applied to damp or dry hair, I usually put it in after I’ve washed and towel dried my hair.  It offers a lot of shine and enhances my natural curls.  It’s also done a great job at taMing my frizz!

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Look at the photos before you buy!
Review: I should have looked at the photos the reviewers posted of their hair before I bought this product!  Such rave reviews, but sure, if you like crispy, greasy-looking hair that looks like you never left the 80s behind… This stuff is terribly expensive, but, I thought I should use a product specifically designed for enhancing curls, after years of just diluting my conditioner and using that as a leave-in, and using Carol’s Daughter Mimosa Hair Honey. With this horrific “smoothie,” my hair was dry as the Sahara no matter how much product I put in, and it was sticky!  It got so horribly tangled and glued together with this junk.  I am used to my hair looking shiny and healthy, and feeling soft to the touch. I wish I could return this smoothie junk and get my money back.  Back to my old combo, if it ain’t broke, don’t fix it!

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 1.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I wanted to like this so badly, not only because it smells really good, but also because I've really been in need of a good, hydrating hair product that actually works.I know that some people have had excellent results with this, but I've only experienced the opposite: this has left my hair a greasy, coated, tangled, and somehow dried out mess. I've experimented with multiple ways of using this, and I don't know why, but it just doesn't work at all for my coarse, thick, dry, damaged, curly/wurly hair.I'm so disappointed that this hasn't worked at all for me, but for whatever reason, it's just horrible for my hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Love it!
Review: We love this product, and frankly this brand! It works wonders on our daughter's hair, and we love how well it works on our daughter's type 2c hair. It is a bit on the heavier side for her hair type, but if we use it sparingly, it does a great job! The container is huge and it will last us a really love time, so I would say this would be great for a family, frankly. The scent is nice - not too heavy, but it does have a good amount of scent via fragrance, which means we have no clue what it is... I don't love that it is not the cleanest ingredient listing, but not too bad overall. This works really well for us, and I am happy.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I love how rich this cream is. It works great for short hair to get curls to coil nicely. My hair is longer and it provides good moisture without leaving it feeling sticky.  This works best for me for a two strand twist set. It has a very pleasant smell that leaves my hair smelling nice all day. Recommended

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Amazing Curling Cream and Great Value
Review: I bought this product from Walmart, not Amazon, but it is the best curling product. I have 3c/3b  ish, high porosity hair and this softens, defines, and moisturizes my curls. The sheamoisture line is completely safe and has amazing natural ingredients which are good for softening and defining coarse curls. The price is unbeatable as well and this lasts me a very very long time. I’ve used the same bottle for about 10 months and I haven’t even used 1/4 of it yet ! Also the smell is amazing compared to other curling creams like cantu.  Amazing product.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have naturally curly hair, and I struggle with dryness and frizz, especially in the fall and winter. I have found Shea Moisture products to be so effective at cutting the frizz and making my hair moisturized. I noticed a clear, recognizable difference, even after the first day of using the product.It smells great, and it applies easily to my damp hair. It leaves my hair smelling good, too, but it's not overwhelming and it does fade over time. The smoothie also doesn't weigh down my hair or leave it feeling sticky or clumpy like other products I've used. It's great!It's also a nice big bottle, and I love the screw on lid. I am less likely to spill it. It's a good value, too!Overall, I can't be happier with the way this product shapes, defines, and tames my curls. Shea Moisture is a new staple for me because of how great it makes my hair look. I highly recommend it!

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I am such a huge fan of the coconut and hibiscus curl enhancing milk from this brand! It's perfect for my thick, wavy long hair, and keeps all of those little frizzy flyaway hairs in check so that I look smooth and professional all day.When I saw that there was a thicker smoothie product in the same line as my curl enhancing milk, I definitely wanted to try it. This is just like the curl enhancing milk and how it works, only it is a little bit thicker. I don't know why, but some days I just have a sense that my hair is needing a little bit of extra care, maybe because I was in the sun and wind too much the day before or maybe I just rinsed my conditioner out to thoroughly, but on those days I use this product instead of the milk and it does the same excellent job of keeping my braid in check and keeping any of the hair that popped out of my braid looking curly and sleek rather than like a frizzy mess.I also love how this stuff smells. It smells just like my curl enhancing milk, a beautiful fragrance of coconuts with just a hint of gentle tropical floral, but really primarily I small coconuts. Definitely recommend this product as well as the curl enhancing milk.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: It has a pretty good thickness for working with natural hair and trying to form curls or twists. I can't say that I'm totally in love with it because I feel like it could work a bit better in terms of softening. Then too, it could just be my hair texture but this wasn't the best product for me. However, when using it on others, it turned out to work well. It smells good and doesn't leave a film or build up that makes your scalp itch. I just say proceed with caution. If you're a product junkie, this will probably end up in your supply anyway.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: The packaging is different from what's pictured. I figured they'd updated the look but I got the same old packaging they've had for years. The product itself is the same as I remember. I use it on my daughter's type 4b hair. Anything else would be too costly on her long, thick hair at this point. It moisturizes well, although it's not the best for curl definition, at least not for type 4 hair. Looser hairtypes (including non-black types) may get better definition. For us it just provides moisture, which I expected, so I can't be disappointed.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: It’s ok does what it’s supposed too
Review: I did not buy this on here but I figured an honest review would help somebody else. This product is very thick but smells amazing. I’ve used it a few times now and I have to say it really makes my curls come out to play. I have 2b-2c thick curly hair. I do not follow the CGM because I don’t keep my hair curly during the winter just summer while it’s humid and my hair is colored. Even so this still helps being out my curl clumps. The only thing I hate about it is that it doesn’t help my frizz what so ever. I use all salon approved shampoos and conditioners because I have colored hair. Other then that it really help my curls show.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Shea Moisture will always be a favorite of mine
Review: Call me crazy, but I've been using this as like a pre-shower conditioner for my hair after it's been straightened. I love love love how it makes my hair feel and you can definitely see/feel a difference in my hair texture after I am done washing. I makes detangling super easy as well! I usually apply this product to sections of my hair then let it sit for around 10 minutes before rinsing then washing. I have absolutely no complaints and will continue to use!

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: I Don't understand the hype
Review: I was excited to try this product; however, I was VERY disappointed.  It smelled wonderful but that is it.  It did not define my curls.  It caused my hair to frizz.  It also left white flecks in my hair that I had to pick out.  Further, as promised, it did not make my hair shine ornate it feel moisturized.  My hair felt dry after I applied it.  The kicker is that it caused my scalp to burn.  I had to immediately wash it out of my hair.  I have used other Shea Butter products and I have never had one of them cause my scalp to burn.  I won't be using this product again and I don't recommend it.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have naturally curly hair, and styling it can be a total pain. I struggle with frizziness and pieces of straight hair (from sleeping on the curls, etc.) mixed in with the curls. This curl enhancing smoothie has been great because it does seem to cut the frizz and it really enhances my curls. Even after the first use, I noticed that my curls were much more defined, and they remained that way throughout the day. What great results!The smoothie smells delicious - like a sweet fruit smoothie. The consistency makes it easy to spread on my hair, and only a little is needed for good results (and I have long hair!). I have used several other Shea Moisture products over the years, and they have all been of the same high-quality. I highly recommend them!

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have two boys with really curly hair that gets a little wild. Their hair needs product to tame their curls but I hate when the product makes their hair sticky and crunchy. This Shea Moisture is natural so I feel good about using it and it smells insanely good - like tropical goodness and not over powering. It keeps their curls tight but soft and bouncy at the same time - adding just the right amount of hold and did I say- smells so good!!!

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: My hair is pretty thick and I have natural waves but I have to use product to really get them to form and stand out. Otherwise I just have frizzy hair. I used this on damp hair and it worked well to bring back the curls a day after my last washing. They don't feel crunchy at all but I can tell there is product on my hair. I'll need to experiment to get the right amount, but it does feel like it moisturizes my hair and it feels more like a conditioner going on my hair rather than a gel, which I like. No one wants crunchy hair. The smell is light and pleasant and the jar is big so it will last me a long time.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Great scent and texture. Well made by reputable company. This product is a staple item in my daughters hair care routine. She has 3C to 4A curls . This products works very well to moisturize and soften her curls. She usually applies it to detangled hair to help it form looser curls as a leave in conditioner. She will also sometimes apply before going to bed then wash out in the morning  for softer controlled curls.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: SheaMoisture Coconut & Hibiscus Curl Enhancing Smoothie
Review: As other reviewers have mentioned the Amazon product page tells you to leave the SheaMoisture Coconut & Hibiscus Curl Enhancing Smoothie in for three minutes after shampooing then rinse out. The jar instructions say this is a leave-in product. I have fine hair, and I have always found leave-in products weigh my hair down, so I decided to use this as a conditioner, rinsing it out after three minutes. Also I think the scent would be over-whelming if you don’t rinse it out.It left my hair very soft with much more volume.  This might work as a leave-in for very heavy or ethnic type hair but I think for average hair it would be much too heavy.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I love this line and this product is no exception.  The scent is a little strong for my tastes but not so strong that I cant (or wont) use it.  It helps cut down on the frizz and helps keep my hair from drying out.  My curls are so much more defined with this.  I do need to add a sealing type product on top to keep the curls but this acts as my moisturizing layer.  Best of all, it has no silicones.  It is a little expensive at the current price of $17, but a little goes a long way so the cost is worth it in the long run in my opinion.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Defines curls really well!
Review: I got this for my toddler’s hair and it works so well! It has a fruity coconut smells which I like better than pure coconut scents. The cream itself is very thick and creamy. It has somewhat of a sticky texture, so I used less product than I usually use in her hair. Her curls are so defined after using it, and the curls stay like that all day.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I like the scent, and unlike another reviewer that said it was over-powering, I did not find that it lasts long. It does calm down the frizzies which I get around my ears for some reason, and I don't like them sticking out of my ball cap, haha. It is a bit heavy and I don't find that it enhances curl much, which in my case is good. I have shoulder length hair and after washing it gets very curly. I've never had curly hair before, so that's perplexing. I usually use a flat iron for a smoother look. This is OK, but I think  I've used better for my tastes.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: My hair is wavy and my daughter and grandson have curly hair and we all three use this to keep our hair conditioned and under control. It leaves our hair soft and silky and it smells so good! We live in the south where heat and humidity can be an issue year round, but it's no longer an issue with this curl enhancing smoothie.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Substantial Smoothing Cream With a Great Fragrance
Review: I really like this curl smoothing cream. It's got a light and very lovely, slight sweet fragrance and does NOT smell like Neem oil at all. Because of all the ingredients, it is a fairly substantial and thick cream, so a little bit goes a long way.I've been using natural products on my very curly hair, and the reduction of chemicals has really made the texture better. Very pleased with this natural product.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Smells Great Moisturizes Better
Review: Pineapples and vanilla - that is what this smells like. It is a pleasant scent, but strong so if you are sensitive to smell, please be aware.My hair is porous 3B/C hair and my hair just loves this stuff. The other cream leave-in I use is Cantu, but I like this so much more than that.It is weightless in my hair, makes it smell good, moisturizes like crazy and absorbs well so it doesn't lay on my hair like oils do.I've tried many products in this line and all have worked well, but I think this is my favorite.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have short to medium curly hair and applied a little bit of this cream to my damp locks. After working this through, I let my hair air dry. This conditioned without weighing down my curls. It also tamed the frizz. The fragrance is wonderful. The cream is thick. Of course, this does make my hair look darker than normal as a result of putting a product in my hair.  The current price of $17.99 is competitive but some local stores do carry this for a lesser price.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a really heavy-duty conditioner.  If you have thin, fine hair... run like the wind. If you have thick, curly, coarse or just thick hair that needs a strong conditioner, you should like this product!  It smells great and made my hair so soft.  It was not too heavy at all, but can see that it could be too heavy for people with thin, fine hair.  If you have thick hair - you'll love it! ~Amy

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Not by itself
Review: Doesn't work on its own:  not enough definition, anti-frizz, or control, and it feels a little greasy. Mixed in a cocktail though with Kinky Curly Original Curling Custard, it works MARVELOUSLY! Used about 1/2 of each, mix well before applying. Applied to DRIPPING WET hair using the praying hands method.My hair type: Low porosity, 2C, medium-coarse, long

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Very moisturizing!
Review: I didn’t expect much but this is very moisturizing! It’s not thick it spreads very easily in your hand so you can apply a small amount on a lot of your hair. I didn’t see much curling occurring when i first used it. I watched a YouTube tutorial on doing a sleek bun and a curling product similar was used so i found this to be a perfect product for moisturizing my hair and combining with gels for a sleek but curly hairstyle. I have kinky curly type 4 hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have very curly hair that’s just past my shoulders. I love using this as a deep conditioner once a week and can get 4-5 applications when generously used. I wash my hair and apply a nice amount, quickly comb though and put my heated head wrap on, leaving it over night sometimes. Then, cool rinse in the morning and my hair is very manageable. I’ve used several of the SheaMoisture products and have had great success without spending a ton of money. The only thing is the scent, I like the scent but it’s a tad strong for me.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Great for Type 3b Hair
Review: I'm currently growing out a pixie cut and transitioning to natural hair after straightening my hair everyday for over 10 years. I'm learning which products are good for my curly hair to keep them looking good and shiny without the dry crunchiness that some products cause. I really like this product because a little goes a long way. I use a small amount of product and comb through my hair before stying and letting it air dry. I love the sweet smell of this product and love how great it makes my hair smell.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I love this on my blonde weave that was dry, and is not anymore after using this.Since using this on my hair it blows out smooth, and has allot of body.On the jar it says to use this as a leave in on damp or dry hair without rinseing out..Although on Amazon it says toLeave this on for 3 mins then rinse out, that I didn’t do.This coconut and hibiscus curl enhancing smoothie works better for my hair then Pureology shampoo and conditioner .Great price for 10.19 for a large jar.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This stuff smells so yummy and works great. I have curly hair and follow the curl girl routine, and this works wonderfully as a cream after I shower. I apply the product when my hair is damp, and it’s helped to define the curl and reduce frizz without leaving my hair greasy. It does say this can be applied to dry hair also, but I haven’t tried that. It’s fairly thick and I feel like greasiness would ensue if applied on dry hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Me fascina
Review: Es la primera vez que usé este producto y me gustó mucho,  me deja el pelo suave, sedoso, brillante, me ayuda a controlar el Freeze las puntas me dejaron impresionada porque normalmente después del cepillado siempre tocaba plancharlas y esta vez divinas desde el principio. Lo seguiré usamdo, Creo que será el nuevo mejor amigo de mi cabello.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Good for curly hair
Review: The smell sometimes might take some getting used to as it is an overly fruity aroma. Leaves hair feeling soft and not too gunky. Does well with my curls. I'd recommend using a mousse for best results. One of the better leave-in conditioners for my  type of hair that I've had a hard time finding.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Makes curly hair look yummy
Review: Smells amazing but a bit strong. This product is definitely CURLY HAIR APPROVED! Wont dry out your hair and or cast. Curls look amazing especially when applying (generously if hair is more curly)on soak and wet hair then letting it air dry or defusing. I find the price to be cheaper at Walmart. Out of their line of products this is definitely a must have.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Love this product
Review: Ok I was skeptical about this but it truly is a great product for my hair. I used it today when I received it yesterday and I must say I truly am very pleased with the outcome. I have natural curls that are tight curls and everything that I have tried dried up within an hour of use and I would have to reapply or wear a hat. I can say that I have had a complete day of moisture in my hair. I am truly impressed and will keep this in my supply of hair supplies.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Great for curly blonde hair too
Review: I get it at my local Sallys- it's a buck or two cheaper than on here. I love this stuff. I have mid back length, white blonde (naturally) 2c/3a hair. Kinda a weird hair type, and it's almost impossible to get a product that makes it manageable, but this stuff works for it. I can put half an average size bottle of conditioner in my hair, and it still wouldn't be soft. This helps get rid of a lot of the tangles and makes it touchable. How i use it, it actually dampens my curls a lil most of the time initially, but they pop back up as soon as it dries.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: good for curls
Review: It really does enhance your curls. For some reason, my hair does not keep moisture. After a couple of hours, my hair feels dry again. It smells really good. The texture of the product is really thick. I thought that due to it being thick it will moisturize my hair really good. I'll try it with water to see if that is any better for me.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Excellent
Review: Finally accepting my curly/wavy hair.  This is a must, keeps hair from getting frizzy.  Smells great.  I tried the same brand in the "milk" and it didn't cut it for me.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Softened my hair
Review: She’s moisture is one of my favorite brands. A lot of the formulas have changed and I don’t think they work as well anymore but this one was spot on. It left my hair feeling smooth, soft, very moisturized. My curls really pop with this too.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Smells like Vomit!
Review: This product has made my hair feel more dry than any cheap store product has ever. My curls are usually tight and bouncy and now they are loose and hard. AND oh my God the smell this stuff smells like Vomit it is nauseating i didn't notice it on day 1 but I woke up this morning to use it and I cant get the smell off my hands and I had to wash it out of my hair because the smell would not dissipate. I wish I had seen the comments saying they had changed the formula before buying.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Worth the Hype
Review: Oh my goodness, I can’t say enough good things about this. I avoided it for a long time because I have low porosity hair and I was afraid it would be too much protein. I finally tried the small version when I ran out of my DevaCurl cream and I am never going to use anything else. My curls have never looked better - I didn’t even realize my curls could be this defined. The smell is -very- strong, and if you have low porosity hair, you may have to start clarifying more often than you’re accustomed to, but it’s so worth it.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Great value for the amount
Review: This is a great product and much much cheaper than in the stores.  I paid a bit less for almost double the volume of the product.  We will be purchasing it again and again.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Natural Moisture
Review: I love Shea Moisture products and have been using Curl Smoothie a long time. It's the perfect moisturizer for my dry coarse hair. I use it with the matching shampoo and conditioner 👍🏼🥰

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Excellent Smoothie for Natural hair Do's
Review: I love the hold for my twist- out or coil hair do's. It is moisturizing and the scent is delicious. In addition it holds the frizz level down. (Big Plus) I have started twisting my sons hair. They are also pleased with the end result.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Works like a charm.
Review: It curls wet hair perfectly. But it has a really strong smell so if that’s something you will find irritating don’t get it.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have curly hair so I'm always looking for something to give it that extra boost of moisture.  This one works okay, but didn't leave my curls feeling "smoothed" out.  Although to be fair I live in the South where the humidity is unforgiving.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Was not surprised that this product would smell amazing. This brand never disappoints. Very little product goes a long way. Defined my hair amazingly. Wont cause heaviness or oiliness.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I've been using this as soon as I get out of the shower, when my hair is still soaking wet. It helps to create really nice curl clumps and dries beautifully. It's not great on refreshing already dried curls though. The smell is fantastic!

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Deceiving products and brand.
Review: My entire family uses Shea Moisture line of products. We used them because we believed this product was made for black hair by black people. We were sadly mistaken. This line may smell great but it does not do well in course hair and does not retain moisture. This product line is truly deceiving people my family and I will never support this company again.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Not Happy
Review: Looks brown instead of white like it's old and been sitting on the shelf, I can barely smell the coconut scent it faded.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: HIGHLY SATISFIED
Review: Great quality item that came with a great price!

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: My daughter love it for Early here and using it for five years wonderful product
Review: This amazing Product for curly hair it does work for curly hair is amazing been  using it  for five years now .

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a great company and I love their products. This works really well on naturally curly hair and you don't need a lot per use.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Greasy, sticky, heavy
Review: I was excited to try this product after hearing good things about the brand. I find even when I use a very small amount it leaves my hair feeling really greasy, sticky, and oddly dry. It’s so heavy on your hair and it just feels like I forgot to wash out a hair mask. I wouldn’t recommend.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Smells great
Review: While I love SheaMoisture products, the curl enhancing smoothie just isn’t super strong. I actually prefer others. If you are looking for a LIGHT curl, then this is for you.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: smells terrible
Review: not only does this make your hair terrible, it makes it have a greasy feel for days. -1 Stars

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: It gives you curls when you don't have any.
Review: This is so far the only product that gives me curls without frizz. All my life I needed to blow dry and flat iron my hair until I saw a video on youtube on this product. I have three months using this product. I used to buy it for $17.99 at a store when I saw it was $10 I brought it right away. I was worried about the reviews on the packaging, but it came in perfect condition.Directions on how I use it:After rising the deep condition, I apply vitamin E oil. Then, I split my hair in sections and apply the smoothie. The last thing I do to it is apply a sculpting gel level 3. However, the smoothie itself should be enough. If I'm going to sleep, I put my hair in twists or braids. The next day I take them off and refresh it.Please note: if you never done curls like me please use a deep condition and sulfate free shampoo and conditioner.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: HORRIBLE Product

It feels very sticky, I can’t even brush through my hair once using the product, on top of that it leaves my hair dry and staticky. Maybe my hair is too fine for it, but this was not a good product for me, will be returning

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: The smell is AMAZING

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz

The directions do say to use it sparingly, and I used it extremely sparingly and still had the problem of it weighing down and not having any volume. So the product does what it's suppose to but I would not recommend if you have fine hair.

Title: Concerned Teacher, Nanny, DayCare Worker.
Review: I've used this product and is great for tight, dry, thick hair as well as curly dry, unmanageable hair.**The 2nd video is offensive to Moms, Teachers of children, and DayCare Workers.The product is a good one however the manner in which the poor Child is being 'Hosed Down' withit, in order to show complete saturation of its' application is offensive..The Mom (whose nails are perfect) is more concerned about getting her Child's hair detangled and less protective over the possibility of the product getting into the Child's growing Eyes, his sensitive Ears, and over his garments which were innodated with much product.It was heartbreaking to watch the Poor Child try to protect itself! This is the Mom's responsibility to both protect the child and to ensure his hair is entangled.Thank you for listening.

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Exactly what I needed
Review: This stuff is AMAZING. I have a lot of fine, low-porosity 3B curly hair, and this product is my new favorite when it comes to styling. The texture, to be completely honest, isn’t my favorite because it’s so thick and just feels kind of gross when I’m scooping it out of the container, but boy does my hair ever like it, and that’s enough for me. It leaves my hair extremely moisturized and smooth, and it gives me SUCH GOOD SLIP, so detangling is a breeze. I typically use my Denman brush after applying this smoothie, and it leaves me with the softest, most defined curls ever. It’s not heavy on my hair once it dries, either. (I’ve also used it before doing my hair in a protective braided style, and that turned out super hydrated and healthy-feeling as well.) Highly recommend for anyone with hair like mine—trust me, it’s popular for a reason!!

Product: SheaMoisture Smoothie Curl Enhancing Cream for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus Sulfate Free and Paraben Free 12 oz
Title: Verified Purchase
Review: Extremely sad as the products spilled all over. Out of the 3 tubs i bought, 2 spilled messily which made the unspilled one really greasy as well. Very upset and hope the seller can improve on quality control of product packaging. I ordered more from the same seller after this purchase and in the past as well. Giving this a 4 star as previous ones came in good condition and shipping time was good. Ordered on 3rd April, received on 10th April. But please improve on product protection in future and thank u for the hard work!As for the product itself, it does really well and leaves my curls soft and mangeable. I have 2c-3a hair

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Does not add weight to your hair
Review: Love the product. I wash my hair and live it on. My curls looks soft and bouncy.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Game-changer for my crazy hair
Review: I'm 29 years old and I have struggled my entire life to get my fluffy, curly hair in order. This is the first product I've found that controls the frizz for a whole day, defines the curls nicely, and does not leave any sort of detectable residue. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars: Its rating on EWG.org/skindeep is a 3, which means it has some health concerns - specifically, it has high levels of allergens and potential irritants. But I haven't had any sort of allergic reaction to it, personally.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Not for me.
Review: I did not care for this product. It was so thick, like a paste. I have  fairly thick, DRY (my hairdresser says I have so much hair lol) hair, medium to fine strands and I really don’t feel like it blended well at all. It made my hair feel heavy and weighed down, not flowing or smooth at all.I don’t use a lot of product or styling tools so my hair is in good shape, although I struggle with parched strands. Finishing oils blended with a carrier moisturizing styling product is a must. My go to has been Sebastian Twisted and Olaples 6 & 7.Not saying this isn’t for you, just wasn’t for me!

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Terrible product. Not as advertised.
Review: If I could give it a lower than 1 star review, I would. This is not as advertised. It’s consistency is like that of glue. It’s scent is overwhelming and obnoxious. It starts drying up as you apply it. The worst part is that, as it dries during application, it pulls hairs out worse than an aggressive brushing! Don’t buy it. Period. End of story.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: moisturizing
Review: I like that the ingredients are fairly clean. I live in an arid climate and this hair smoothie helps with static fly-away hair and maintaining some curl.

Title: just natural spiral curls and I LOVE this brand and I LOVE this product

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Smells nice, very heavy
Review: This is a product that was made for thicker/curlier hair but was not amazing for me. It smells wonderful and if I use a very tiny amount (smaller than pea sized as I have short hair) I get great curls but they end up very dry by the end of the day. Using more just dried my hair more.  This line of products have been hit or miss for me. I have a deep conditioner that I love but this one in particular didn't work for me.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: I love it!
Review: I still need to let my hair air dry slowly to get curls since I have super fine hair, but I still haven’t found a better product out there to make my curls defined and stay curly! Once it’s dry, I fluff the curls and split them up a bit, and they are beautiful!

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Gives your hair a natural no mouse/hairspray look
Review: Love this product the softness it leaves on the hair no crunchy or hardness or hair falling out from removing the product.I use it on my wet hair ends  then blow dry and looks like I’ve gone to the salon. The glow it leaves is so remarkable and very lightweight.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Didn't Trust Packaging
Review: I purchased 2 bottles SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair because I've never had a Shea Moisture product I didn't like. Unfortunately, I'd never purchased this product and gave it a 3-star rating because there was no protective shrink wrapping or foil sealing of the bottles. I really don't like  untrustworthy packaging of products going into or on my body and hair.  I returned the product.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Great for curly hair
Review: This is another product recommended to my son.My son has curly hair and wears it in a few styles. The style of choice is to allow his curls to flow. Given this is the style of choice, my son has been using numerous products as it has been challenging to find one that doesn't flake or cause his scalp to become very dry.I am happy to note, he has not complained and has requested more. So I am certain the product meets the expectations.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Works for my summer frizz
Review: This works amazing on my summer frizzy curls. I apply a very small amount and just let my curls dry naturally. The curls stay together nicely. Don’t use too much though or your hair feels dirty and curls are too heavy to stay curly.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Not what I expected
Review: While it does hold my curls, it doesn't leave them soft and feeling well conditioned.  I have t break them apart still or my hair will look wet all day, more like what a gel does.  The curl and style milk works better for softness so I end up using both at the same time.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: The results from using this hair product was devastating.
Review: I was very disappointed with this hair product. It said on the tube moisture and curl Define thick curly hair. I found that it is just the opposite. It actually dried my hair out and took out the curls.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Great for enhancing waves and curls!
Review: I have 2c hair that I like to be as curly and moisturized as possible, which is hard in the desert climate I live in. This stuff is the best at helping me keep frizz at bay and define my waves! I apply a tiny amount to my shaggy pixie cut when needed after a shower, and it looks great. Not greasy or gummy or crunchy at all. If you have thick wavy hair that you want to take care of and see more curls from, I recommend this product!

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Warning for people with tree nuts allergies
Review: Don’t buy if you have nut Allergies.  I bought this for my daughter who is  allergic tree nuts..  it sent her to the emergency room.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Helped me get waves
Review:

   I’m biracial , my hair is soft but straight , used this for a week, I also used Torino brush and a du rag every night

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Love it
Review: My son has very curly hair so I’m learning how to care for it and this has helped keep the curls hydrated and healthy looking. We love it

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Very nice for thick wavy hair
Review: I like to use this product to enhance the definition of my very thick, wavy hair to make it look more curly. It smells very nice, like pina colada. The smell fades a little bit with time if fragrance overwhelms you so that shouldn't bother you. I would not recommend this for thin or straight hair, I think it would be too heavy. You only need a little bit of this on wet hair to instantly have better curls. My only complaint is that it is a very fine line between the perfect amount of product and too much, so don't use a lot.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Definitely Moisturizes
Review: OmG I love this product and will definitely order again! It keeps my hair moisturized

Title: Love this product
Review: Love shea moisture products and this 1 is great too! Lightly scented so ur hair just smells clean, a little goes a long way with this product. I use it on my hair wet and let my curls dry naturally...no frizz!

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Extremely heavy product

Product: SheaMoisture Curl Enhancing Smoothie for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut & Hibiscus to Reduce Frizz, 6 Oz
Title: Disgusting

Title: Moisture!!!!

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus with Shea Butter, 12 oz
Title: Very thick & coconut like scent
Review: This is a good deep conditioner. It is very thick and weighs my high porosity, medium/coarse ,  type 4 hair down. I mix it with water or a lighter conditioner for better hair penetration. This conditioner does not have much slip (ability to comb through). I detangle my hair before I use this. It does soften and moisturized my hair. The scent is light , smells like hibiscus and more tropical. Overall, I would recommend it to someone with very thick hair and coarse hair however it  was not good for detangling purposes for me and too thick for my preference.

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus with Shea Butter, 12 oz
Title: Love it!
Review: I have been natural for over 10 yrs. I recently did a "big chop" to give my hair a new start. This product has brought my dry & course hair back to life. I let it sit in my hair for about 30 min under a heating cap. My hair is super soft & my curls are "juicy!" I intend to stick with the Shea Moiture line on my new hair journey.

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus with Shea Butter, 12 oz
Title: i bought this 2 times and the package was completely damaged. shame on amazon!!!
Review: I love shea moisture products, but there is something that MUST BE DONE to improve delivery of this cream. I ordered 2 times and both of them the product came completely open, with cream all over the package and without any protection from the brand as well.very disappointed with it. I'll need to buy it somewhere else.

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus with Shea Butter, 12 oz
Title: Super hydrating
Review: I put this hair masque on after shampooing. I then cover my hair with a plastic cap and a heated conditioning cap. I leave on for 15-30 minutes then rinse. My hair is ultra soft and manageable. I then use Shea Moisture Curling Gel Souffle for 2-strand twists. I keep those in for 2 days and I have the most beautiful twist-out!

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus with Shea Butter, 12 oz
Title: Not amazing on my 2B curly hair
Review: The product came with a cracked top and the seal was open also.I kept it anyway to try the product. I won’t buy again. It didn’t do anything amazing for my curls. I will keep trying other stuff till I get it right!

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus with Shea Butter, 12 oz
Title: good
Review: it left my hair feeling very soft upon drying, but i did remove a star bcse it is supperrr thick, if you are looking for slip in a hair masque this does not have it at all. I have low porosity, type 3 curly course and thick hair and left it on my hair for an hour and covored my hair with 2 plastic shower caps then with my hot head heated cap, it did obsorb really well and i rinsed with cool water, i would use this again but would add oils in it to help with some slip.

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus with Shea Butter, 12 oz
Title: Amazing
Review: This cream is amazing. I used it on human Brazilian wavy hair. It jumped started the curls and then some. I even tried it on some pre stretched synthetic hair. Look at that hair. The pic is of the synthetic hair that has been curled using the hot water method. The mask didn’t even mess up the curl.

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus with Shea Butter, 12 oz
Title: It's smell so good!

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus with Shea Butter, 12 oz
Title: SheaMoisture for Curly Hair
Review: Works well with my natural curls. Keeps them soft, shiny & manageable. I’ve even slept in it & rinsed the next day. Highly recommend

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus with Shea Butter, 12 oz
Title: Love the scent and it did a great job!
Review: The water at my apartment is very hard (since using this product I have purchased a softener), but after using this product I absolutely noticed a positive difference in my hair! Added a softness and shine to my hair that was previously dry and gross from the hard water. I also think it smells great. Definitely recommend!

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus with Shea Butter, 12 oz
Title: Love this product
Review: My hair has no been trimmed in a year due to the pandemic.  I have naturally curly hair but it gets frizzy and especially at the ends once damaged.  I color my hair and live where it is dry.  Winter heating in the house is brutal.  Using this product totally restores moisture.  I still need a haircut but the product really helps.

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus with Shea Butter, 12 oz
Title: Soft Hair and I do care
Review: This product is great. I have curly hair, and I comb it through and let it sit for approximately 45 minuites, and when I washed it out my hair was soft and shiney. It was a pretty thick conditioner, but effective.

Title: Sheamoisturizer is my favorite hair product brand
Review: All the hair products I use are from sheamoisturizer. It’s safe, clean, and affordable. All products do not contain alcohol, sulfate, or silicon. Great choice for curly hair!

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus Hair Mask with Shea Butter 12 oz
Title: A container of truth for anyone wanting silky smoothness!! Yass!!
Review: I absolutely love Shea Moisture.. I just wish they could make a bigger size of this coconut 🥥 scented deep conditioner for my curly hair!!I wash my hair with the Shea coconut shampoo first and than apply about a half a golf ball size to my wet parted hair in the shower - start from the top and work the moisturizer to the ends. I do not run it in with my fingers as this actually creates frizz, but rather use I use my palms to smooth it down to the ends of my hair (just a little trick for my curly hair girls out there!)I wait about five to ten minutes and Then I detangle from the ends going towards my scalp with a wide tooth comb. When I tell you that this conditioner is the truth!!! You should not have any hair even come off your head and onto the comb- that’s how smooth and creamy this product is. After a quick rinse you will have ringlets of pure silk on your head!! Before I leave it to air dry , I will apply defining creme (Shea Moisture again! Woop! And only with the hand 🤚 palm technique- woop woop!) and when it’s all said and dry - expect the softest looking curls EVER; you might even slap yourself you look so good!!

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus Hair Mask with Shea Butter 12 oz
Title: Great for 4 type hair!
Review: My hair love this product! Great for voluminous and thick hair that needs lots of hydration and hard to tame

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus Hair Mask with Shea Butter 12 oz
Title: Best masque I've tried (and I've tried many)
Review: I have very curly, color treated hair and my hair gets DRY.  I have tried many different masques and I always return to this.  I will never stray again.  Love it!!

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus Hair Mask with Shea Butter 12 oz
Title: Just meh.... not impressive
Review: Not really a mask worth writing home about. Probably going to try a different product. It doesn’t moisten it rinses right out leaving your hair still dry feeling. I’ve used many masks and conditioners this just doesn’t meet up to its advertising that’s for sure... the shampoo and conditioner combo fromThis brand is great but I don’t recommend this mask. Save your money for something that works!

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus Hair Mask with Shea Butter 12 oz
Title: NICE deep conditioner BUTTTT…
Review: If you have 4c low porosity hair… you should use this once a month. It contains protein and our low porosity hair doesn’t need ALOT of that.. my hair started to snap( a little) when i was using this once a week..:

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus Hair Mask with Shea Butter 12 oz
Title: Smells amazing
Review: Absolutely love this stuff. Have used it for a while. I have very thick and wavy hair. This leaves my hair smelling great, very shiny and very soft. Doesn’t weigh it down either.

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus Hair Mask with Shea Butter 12 oz
Title: Best hair product ever
Review: The best hair product I’ve ever used. It’s brought new life to my  white, thin, wavy  hair. Even after buying and using my first jar, I tried a few similar products to see if I was imagining the improvement. Nope. None worked as well.

Product: SheaMoisture Hair Masque for Dry Curls Coconut & Hibiscus Hair Mask with Shea Butter 12 oz
Title: Weekly treat
Review: Smell and effect is awesome. I use as a once a week booster for bar conditioners. It makes my curls bouncy and detangles like I never had this 2 feet of rats nest of mess piled up from the gym. For long, course, curly hair I use a quarter size blop and whip it up in my hands, leave it for 10 minutes. Love it.
