Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: When this first arrived, I immediately put a dime-sized amount into my dry hair. And I liked it--it seemed to work with the mousse I already had in my hair, didn't weigh it down too much, and seemed to revive the curl just a bit. Cool, I thought.Each time I've tried to use it, since then, I haven't been as delighted. I have applied it to wet hair after showering. It doesn't have enough "hold" to help my hair stay in curls when applied to wet hair. My course hair falls barely wavy without product but with mousse or gel it holds up to a ringlet-like twist. A #1/flexible hold product like Aussie Sprunch Mousse and Leave-in Conditioner generally results in curls for me, even after sleeping on it for the night, but not this styling milk. I think it's more appropriate for hair that holds curls on its own rather than needs some "help" to get there. For my hair, this product is best used *sparingly.*When applied to wet hair in greater amounts (less than I use of gel, but more than just one dime) my hair feels yucky until I wash it next. It is stiff like hair that is saturated in oils and hasn't been washed for a long time, not stiff like crunchy. Applied heavily like a gel it's yuck, applied sparingly like a smoothing balm it's OK.It definitely has anti-frizz results for me, at least while it's applied. I haven't noticed an overall frizz reduction over time if I don't apply the styling milk.I don't really like the scent, but my guess is it's the neem oil so "to be expected" from any product containing neem oil. It's not a perfumey scent at all.To compare to some other Shea Moisture products that you might debate between, I also use (not at the same time as the styling milk) Shea Moisture 100% Virgin Coconut Oil Daily Hydration Finishing Oil Serum, which gives more *shine* than this styling milk, but not quite as much de-frizzing unless I use too much oil but that just looks greasy. I also like the 100% Virgin Coconut Oil Daily Hydration Styling Gel, which does have a crunch (despite its claims) but better hold after scrunching the crunch than this styling milk while still doing a decent amount of smoothing/frizz-prevention.For curlier hair than mine, I'd suggest more toward the styling milk or the oil serum for smoothing or shine, respectively, but for not super curly hair types like mine, the milk probably isn't the best of the Shea Moisture choices.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: My son's long 3a/3b curls are just awesome, but his low porosity hair makes upkeep a disaster.  However, when I used the SheaMoisture Coconut & Hibiscus Curl & Style Milk, 8 Fluid Ounce on his curls, an entire week went by with absolutely gorgeous curls that were definitely hot n' poppin'!  After doing our usual wash day routine using the entire SheaMoisture Low Porosity line.  (Shampoo, Conditioner, and Manuka Honey Deep Conditioner).  I then detangled using the SheaMoisture 100% Virgin Coconut Oil Daily Hydration Leave-In Treatment.  Lastly, I detangled more using this Coconut & Hibiscus Curl & Style Milk.  I then sealed a little bit with SheaMoisture FlaxSeed Oil and Argan Oil.  (I'm really not an exclusively SheaMoisture girl, it just worked out that way that day)AN ENTIRE WEEK!!  An entire week went by with detangled, moisture locked in curls.  The frizzies stayed away until the end of the week.  Plus, detangling on his tenderhead was so much easier!  So, for him, this was a godsend.  I haven't tried it on my 4C low porosity hair, but I will bet it will not work since nothing works on 4C hair.  However, for my son, I can't be more happy.Now, at $16 a bottle!  Yeah, no.  I've never paid more than $12 from anything SheaMoisture.  So, when this bottle runs out, I'm going to have to think long and hard about whether I want to continue with this product.  Also, the bottle really isn't conducive to allowing the product to come out.  I have to take the cap off and shake it out onto my hand.  So, this product is great for 3a/3b folks, but at $16 for 8oz. I would be trying to find something else, which is a shame because SheaMoisture typically has really great products at decent prices.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I wish I had started using this 30 years ago. I've got 2C-3C typish hair, I think. If it's short, it's in natural ringlets. Anyhow. This product smells delicious, makes your hair look so shiny & so healthy. It glides thru your damp hair & defines your curls with absolutely NO crunch. None. Amazing! I'm in love. I shall not use any other hair product for my curls again. Thats a promise. Thank you so much Sheamoisture!!✔ Yes, I recommend this product.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I’m not a fan of this product. It smells great, but that’s pretty much where the positives end for me. First off, it’s really hard to squeeze out of the bottle. Either the packaging is poor, or the cream is too thick, or a combination of both. That’s the least of the problems though. The first time I used it, my hair felt gross, especially up by my scalp. Kind of a greasy, sticky feeling, like I’d run a bunch of pomade through my hair. It did a good job holding the curl and the volume though. So the next time I used a lot less, concentrating on the ends, and avoiding the scalp area completely. My curls aren’t holding as well, but my scalp are STILL feels gross.There are plenty of curl products out there, and without the trade off of having untouchable, gross feeling hair. Perhaps people with a different curl texture would have better success (I’m about a 3A), but this product isn’t for me.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: TOP 50 REVIEWER
Review: I'm a HUGE fan of Shea Moisture products. They really deliver on the moisture. I tried this product a while ago and didn't like it. I decided to try again using a new methodology because I kept hearing good things about it. I would suggest applying this product to wet hair. The first time I used it, it flaked up as it dried. I'm pretty sure it was because I used too much and my hair wasn't wet enough. I got much better results this time. My hair was soft and defined, though not nearly as much as with gel. The scent might be a little much for some, but I like it. I can now confidently recommend this product.Thanks so much for reading this review. I hope the information that I've provided makes your decision a little easier.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Difficult bottle
Review: This is a decent leave-in conditioner.  It is not as great at reducing frizz as I had hoped.  The packaging also leaves something to be desired.  First, the formula: this leave-in is stiffer than I was expecting (which I actually like) and it is one of those products where you need to use less than you think.  It disperses out through the hair, and combs through easily.  It has definite leave-in conditioner effects, leaving my hair softer and more comb-able after washing.  The scent is quite nice- mostly coconut, tropical, and slightly milky.  In terms of frizz control, I have definitely used better products than this.  My hair is wavy, and it has a strong tendency to frizz out into a mess.  This product did not do all that much to control my frizz.  I've found other things to be more effective.  Finally, the big issue I have with this is that it is very difficult to get out of the bottle.  It comes in a standard shampoo bottle, but it's way too thick to come effectively down the bottle and out the hole.  After a shower, when your hand and bathroom are wet and steamy, getting this out of the bottle is quite a chore. I don't want to have to allocate extra time in my morning routine to shaking and cajoling my hair products out of a bottle.  For that reason, I would not repurchase this.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Not that impressed with this shea moisture product. I have used several of their products for about 5 years now, but have not tried this specific one. I mainly have used their jarred leave in products. This product was pretty thick so a little bit difficult to dispense. It smells pretty good. I didnt like the way it made my hair feel though and I'm pretty sure it made my dandruff worse. I dont even use the product on my scalp but noticed that it seemed worse after using it. I have naturally thick, curly, and frizzy hair and this didnt seem to help with my hair. It was worth a shot but I dont think I'd use this specific product again.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I like coconut but the smell in this reminds me of Banana Boat sun oil from years ago. Everyone at the pool and the beach smelled coconutty. As I got older and started using more natural items - of which coconut oil is generally present, the smell is not too much after a few minutes. I put some on my hair with a bit of water and brushed through the curls and I didn't get one tangle. I always have to leave conditioner on my hair after I shampoo and rinse so that I can brush through or comb through my long hair. This works well. It is also cost effective because it requires a small amount.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I'm surprised at how much I love this! I have hair that is wavy, not necessarily curly, but definitely a thick bodied wave. I often wear my hair in a braid so I don't usually use styling products too much, just a teeny bit to keep my flyaway's under control.In the interests of testing this is thoroughly a somebody else would, I combed a good-sized job through all of my hair rather than just in a couple areas where I usually need a little more control, and it didn't act like a styling product to me so much is just a deeper leave in conditioner that helped my hair kind of stay well-behaved. I didn't notice any residue that I found uncomfortable or unattractive, just nicer hair.And I really appreciated how delightful and yet subtle the fragrance was. There's just enough fragrance that I feel I'm using an exciting and luxurious product without so much that it disagrees with me or makes me sneeze. It smells like coconuts and like a tropical flower.Overall I would really recommend this for people who have wavy hair or thick hair of any texture.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This reminds me of oiling up everything with coconut oil and then getting into a box lined with aluminum foil in the 80s, when we used to work on our tans by burning the living daylights out of our skin.  The smell though!  The Hawai'ian Tropics scent, the coconut!  This smells like THAT and THAT was wonderful.Yes, I know it was a bad idea.  But it smelled so great!It left my hair feeling all rich and thick and coconutty.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: The first time I used this, I squirted a healthy pile into my palm, about the amount I would do for conditioner. It was laborious—the bottle is not designed to squeeze (and it loses a star for it). It smelled great, and my hair felt wonderful... for the day. When I brushed it out that night, though, it was sticky and I ended up washing it a day or two later because I couldn’t stand it. It wasn’t greasy, it just was kind of sticky and hard to brush (easy to put up in a bun though!!). Darn.The second time I used it, I squirted a dainty amount on my palm. Let’s say the size of a quarter. My hair liked it. I scrunched my hair a little bit and it didn’t seem like enough. However, my hair remained curly throughout the day (which to be fair it does anyway when I air dry it), and was luxurious thereafter.The lesson? Don't use too much and it’s dandy.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: I have thick curly hair with an oily scalp. It is very hard for me to find products that will moisturize my hair without leaving it limp and oily looking. Well this SheaMoisture Coconut & Hibiscus Curl & Style Milk has been heaven sent! The scent is truly amazing. The coconut scent is tempered by the slight floral aroma of the hibiscus. After applying to my damp hair, I smell the fragrance for days. People at work continue to complement my hair and the scent. My husband loves the smell as well, and this is rare for a man. I have completely stopped using moose or gel in my hair. This product helps to hold my curl. When my hair is completely dry I apply hairspray, but that has been all I needed. My frizz is gone completely, and I am left with soft and defined curls. I love this product!

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is a leave in conditioner which for me are not ideal.  I already have oily hair so these leave install don't work well for me.  My wife has dry hair and likes this a lot.  She isn't thrilled with the scent (to coconut smelling) but says it dissipated quick enough.  Helps control split ends and the frizzies.  My wife says this is one of the better keave instead she has used.  I tried it once and had to wash it out as I did not like how it left my hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: From bouncy light curls to heavy oily waves
Review: Leaves my hair kind of oily and heavy no matter how long I rinse out the conditioner. I dont mean just the scalp, I mean like half way down the shaft. My sister has struggled with dry hair and while it was nice to see hair moisturized, it was starting to also give her hair an oily effect. Maybe this is a sign of healthier hair?I also noticed my hair doesnt hold curls very well after switching to this conditioner. Even after washing and rinsing hair thoroughly, it still feels like product stays in my hair and weighs it down. As a result, my hair is more heavy and wavy rather than having lightweight, bouncy curls.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review: The styling milk is really hard to get out of the bottle. It has that tiny push top opening, but it does nothing. I had to unscrew the cap and shake the bottle until stuff would come out, because it is so thick. THey should have made the bottle from softer plastic, I guess, so we could actually squeeze it.The milk does smell nice, and it has light hold. It did not weigh my hair down. But it made my scalp itchy and the hair looked oily quite too soon. I do not think I will bother with it again

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Oily feel but great curls
Review: I'm on the fence with this. I love the way it smells and the way my curls feel perky and in shape after I use it.But then. Then it happens. The curls remain but this sense of oil and dirty hair. Second or third day hair. That's what happens.  After about an hour it really feels annoying and I even checked to see if I had residue on my blouse from it (there wasn't).I'm not sure what I'll do when this runs out. I will finish it but will update if I decide to purchase.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Nearly Impossible to Use
Review: I think the product itself is good, I enjoy how my hair looks with it, but my hair has to be darn near soaking wet for it to distribute somewhat evenly. The biggest flaw is I need my 6’2 boyfriend to squeeze any out of the bottle. It is almost impossible to get any product out of the bottle it’s literally stuck in there and SO THICK. I stored upside down and nothing! How is this marketed as a “milk”??

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Smells wonderful
Review: I’m a fan of this! It is very easy to use and gives my hair a lot of extra moisture and shine.  It doesn’t make my hair feel crunchy at all.  I usually apply it when my hair is wet and work it through the ends.  It doesn’t take much product to get the job done even though I have a lot of hair.This smells amazing and I would continue to use it just for the smell alone!

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Buy with caution - formula has changed for the worst :(
Review: They must have changed the formula! This product was literally perfect for years and years. This recent bottle was very different. The product is so thick that I couldn't even get it out of the bottle. When I finally got a little amount out, it had no slip and felt like I was putting sticky hand lotion in my hair. I ended up trying to recycle the bottle and the toss the rest of the product - but even the bottle was impossible to get clean. Very sad.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Greasy!
Review: Left my hair feeling greasy, not moisturized, yet somehow still frizzy. Def a heavy product. I want curls that are soft enough I can run my fingers through, but this just made my hair stringy and knotted. This isn’t the one for me, so the search continues! Gave one star for the pleasing scent and one star for value.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: We always look for the best for our health and that includes our hair. That is why this humectant without sulfates, without parabens, without phthalates, without propylene glycol, without mineral oil, without tests with animals and without oil is what we need. Its delicious scent of coconut invites you but that yes, it is not cloying that you feel that you have fruits on your head and everyone persists your coconut smell. I like your result and I recommend it.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Too Much for My Hair - Best for Curly, Dry Hair
Review: A little goes a long way…..  Even with a small amount, this weighs down my hair.  I have naturally wavy hair, healthy & an oily scalp.  I think this is best for very curly or dry hair.  It would also be good to slather on at the beach – which is how I will use it.  It will protect my hair, allow me to comb it out & it smells like beachy coconut.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 3.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I have naturally wavy hair which I routinely color, and it's also rather thick, so I appreciate a moisturizing curl product. This one smelled fine to me, but was just too thick and left my hair looking really dirty and oily. Even when I used a LOT less (so much less I wasn't sure it would even work at all), my hair still looked terrible. It was bad enough that I washed it again the same day! Bummed it didn't work out for me.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Wrong Consistency
Review: The product was not soft or easy to come out of the bottle.  I expected it to be the consistency of a lotion instead it was like cream.  That would have been ok if it was not in a bottle.  It is useless since I can't get it out of the bottle.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 2.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This is really thick, and I love the scent.  Unfortunately, even mixing this 50/50 with water, it makes my hair look so greasy that it looks and feels dirty an hour after I've used it.  I have dry hair, and this is the first leave-in that has done that to me.  I can't recommend it.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: A must have
Review: My hair is curly, fine and dry. I use the Diva line for my shampoo, conditioner and gel. This is the last product I put on my wet hair, to stop the frizzies and to moisturize the ends. It works well with the gel to lock in the moist curls, and it smells so good.  Someone at Target told me about this product when we were shopping in the curly hair section. I fell in love with it instantly and will never use anything else.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Great product but the bottle is too hard to squeeze
Review: This really helped my newly acquired chemo curls come to life. But am unsure if I would purchase this again as it is a struggle to squeeze the product out. If I wack the bottom with the cover off...too much comes out and is almost impossible to put back. Did anyone even try this prior to marketing?

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Works
Review: This stuff smells great, looks like hair lotion, and moisturizes your curls all day. Mine were left feeling soft and the most manageable I've had them in awhile after applying this product. I would highly recommend. I received this product for free in exchange for my honest opinion.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Great leave-in moisturizing hair conditioner. I have long, fine hair. I dispense a dime-sized amount onto my hands and then work it through my damp hair after shampooing. It has a very pleasant scent and is creamy but light.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Great investment. I really love the smells. It help my curls to keep looking good. My hair used to trap air humidity so it makes it looks horrible. This product make my hair stay at the same condition the whole day.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: This product was okay
Review: I loved the smell of this product and it was moisturizing, but my hair is really dry so i needed additional moisture

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Heaven in a bottle
Review: I will be purchasing this product from now on.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: This leave-in Hair conditioner smells like coconut, apply to towel dried damp hair and your hair will be easy to style and manage. I use it after every shampoo and have been very pleased.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: I have 2C, naturally platinum blonde hair, wasnt as expected
Review: I have very long, layered, thick wavy/curly hair that is naturally very blonde with some strawberry highlights. I swim almost daily which is difficult to keep hair manageable being washed this often. I was looking for a styling product I could brush through the hair when damp so it would air dry to the locks I desire without frizz.First, when I read 'milk' I thought it was a much thinner product... This is in a bottle- but definitely more of a paste. Difficult to get out with wet hands or if you had arthritis. In that same respect I used about 1 tablespoon total- with not enough reduction of frizz (especially in the back- where I wanted it) and found it heavy in the front (where I like it to 'flow' more?... this might make sense to those of us with this hair type). The smell is great however so I will use it up, but be seeking something more of a 'leave-in conditioner' type for my hair so I have more liberating control.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Great for frizzy hair.
Review: I am of Hispanic and French nationality.  I have naturally curly hair and with that comes dryness.  This product is great at keeping the frizz down and giving my hair moisture.  The only bad thing about this product is it is super thick and very hard to squeeze out of the bottle (it's the product itself, not a seller issue).

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Great
Review: Okay I was super skeptical but it works great! Smells great, gets curls, helps w h my frizzy hair! There is one thing you need to know, if you use a lot of conditioner and then this product your hair will be very oily. So wash it with shampoo after and then do the product.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: The Only Thing I Like is the Scent
Review: I have 3C curly hair.  My mother is a registered cosmetologist and has access to all types of hair products.  I was looking for something to use and came across this "Style Milk".  First thing that I noticed is how difficult it is to get the product out of the bottle.  Once in my hand, it is not creamy or smooth at all.  It has a weird texture and just sits on my hair until I comb or rub through it.  The smell is delicious, and it does not leave my hair crunchy, however it doesn't work with my hair.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Powerful product!
Review: As some others have noted when I used a lot, my hair got crunchy and sticky. I have 2B/2C hair that’s pretty dry and coarse, past my shoulders. Now that I use about a penny sized squirt it’s magic! It holds waves together well.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Great product!
Review: My daughter, who is 6, has extremely thick, curly, dry and frizzy hair. Her hair type is 3B. I have been searching for decent products that actually do what they are supposed to and don't break the bank. This is it! It moisturizes and keeps her hair soft. I do use a combo of other products, but with this being a part of our regimen, we are no longer dealing with frizz! So thankful I found this product.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Not my cup of tea
Review: So, I use Shea moisture shampoo and conditioner and thought I'd give this a try to help tame my curly hair. Unfortunately I was a little disappointed as it made my hair feel a little greasy and heavy. Not sure if I put too much in or what...but will probably not use. It does have a nice scent though.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Deliciously happy hair!
Review: I have used several variations of Shea Moisture products, the coconut hibiscus is best for my hair type (2b-2c). They all smell great.  For awhile I strayed away from it and tried different products, that was a huge mistake. Now that I am back to Shea Moisture, coconut hibiscus shampoo, conditioner, co-wash and curl style milk, my hair is so happy! I will not mess with other products again.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: For anyone wanting curl
Review: I have short, naturally curly hair and this is so helpful for me. I put it on wet haie, let dry and fluff...beautiful curl!

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: VINE VOICE
Review: Shea Moisture is family owned and its legacy dates back to 1912.  The Coconut and Hibiscus curl and style milk is very thick and heavily coats my hair.  I have thick hair that is wavy to curly. I style with heat and also set my hair for no heat curls or waves.  The Shea Moisture may be too thick for some but it is very hydrating. It can and will leave a texture depending on the application. I could see how rich and nourishing this formula was the first day I used it.  I have used it for a month regularly and liberally and I still have well over half of the bottle left.  I put a little in my hands and rub them together.  Then I wet my hands and put them through my wet hair.  This makes it a little more diluted and gets through my hair.  This has worked in any way that I have styled my hair.  It smells like coconuts and it lasts.  It contains coconut oil, vegetable glycerin, soybean oil, carrot root extract, shea, silk, and more.  If you know how to work with a heavier cream and are looking for something nourishing, this will work well.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Perfect for curly waves. <3
Review: I have really thick and naturally curly/wavy hair so I was trying to find something that would make them stand out more and I found this as a suggestion on a beauty site and B O I is this it. They're definitely sticking out now! I tried Cantu but it just made my curls too tight. This one did the job. I followed the instructions and left my hair damp before putting it on (towel dried most of the moisture). It's kind of hard to squeeze out of the bottle. But that's the only issue I have with the product.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Report abuse
Review: Leí varios comentarios respecto a que te deja sensación pegajosa y el asunto es este:No es el shampoo lo pegajoso sino la acumulación de productos con silicona, aceites sintéticos y demás que suelen venir en shampoos menos naturales. Si ya vas a cambiar para usar Shea moisture, recomiendo primero hacer una limpieza profunda con un shampoo sencillo, normalmente de los transparentes, porque ese dejará el cabello sin residuos. Después de usarlo puedes utilizar toda la línea de Shea moisture sin tener inconvenientes, y de verdad vale el precio y queda perfecto. Tengo el cabello decolorado y estaba muerto antes de cambiarme a esta línea, ahora se ve casi como antes de someterlo a procesos químicos.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Report abuse
Review: Esperaba que me ondular más el cabelloz pero creo que el shampoo y las cremas están enfocados a un rizo más pegado y no tan ligero como mi cabello ondulado, el olor es muy rico, solo que en mi caso mi cabello ha pasado por varios tintes y después de lavarlo con el shampoo lo deja como chicloso o algo duro para nada se siente suave y sedoso.Con las cremas me ha pasado algo similar no enriza sino que lo deja deuro, pero creo que es eso que está enfocado a un cabello más sRizado que al mío.

Product: SheaMoisture Curl and Style Milk for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus for Curl Definition 8 oz
Title: Report abuse
Review: Me gustó mucho el aroma y su consistencia, solo que al tener coco hay que evitar usarlo diario para evitar la saturación... y claro que forma los rizos hermosos!

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Product has changed
Review: I love this gel and have had great success with it as I follow the CGM and like a natural product. The consistency of this gel has completed changed and was very difficult to work with. I don't know if I received a bad batch or that they changed the product but I was so disappointed.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: How did this make it out of the factory??
Review: I have used this product before, albeit I bought in person and perhaps that's the mistake I'm making.  Usually, this product should be a runny, batter like texture, but when I opened this gel it was SOLID LIKE JELLO. I tried rubbing it in my hands and it  just crumbled. I really like shea moisture products, but I might take a break from them for a while. The gel is unusable and I'm very disappointed and will now have dry hair since I have to wait for another product to ship.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Horrible texture
Review: I thought thus was the gel which I’ve been using for months and loved  But that product said curling custard. The reason rite was so wrong. Instead of gel consistency it was super thick and chuncky. It didn‘my hold at all.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: ADD WATER AND MUSH IT UP! It works.
Review: Ok, so i felt terrible for impulsively buying this cause the reviews were brutal! Once it arrived, as described, it was solid and gelatinous. I was like howww will i get this on my hair even ???WATER!! You break it apart with your fingers and then add water and BADABING, it’s beautiful. My curls are no longer frizzy, i can look super cute for my zoom date :,) If you don’t mind the two extra steps, I recommend.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Not sure I will buy again
Review: The product does smell good for sure. What i dislike is thatvtge product is really hard and lumpy because I believe it's suppose to be soft gel but it's really hard.Gave 2 stars because it smells good.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Disappointed in product
Review: I typically have great luck with this product. This one came almost like solid brick of gel, and doesnt work the same because of all the work trying to make it the same consistency as others I have purchased. I was disappointed receiving this one.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: New Formula that they didn’t tell you about!
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   This product is absolutely horrible. I’ve used the Gel Soufflé for years, then suddenly a few months ago I wasn’t able to find it in the stores anymore. I finally decided to just order it, and there’s a good reason why it’s off the shelves. It’s between the texture of jello and ballistic gelatin. It doesn’t dissolve in your hair, it’s clunky if you even try to rub a quarter size amount in your palms just to apply to your hair. I never hated a product from Shea Moisture in life, until I tried the Gel Soufflé. This is not the Soufflé of the past, the company was sneaky and changed the formula. The first 4 formulas are cheap fillers: Glycerin (Vegtable); Water; Corn Syrup; Pectin.I am not at all pleased. I tried to like it, but my hair said otherwise. The Soufflé left a strange film on the top of hair. I have very curly thick hair, and I live in the dry climate of North East Colorado. The previous Soufflé was great in helping my hair retain moisture. The new Soufflé is the complete opposite. I’m beyond disappointed.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Bad batch
Review: I have used this product for years and I typically go into the local pharmacy and pick up a jar but I decided this time to get one from Amazon. When it arrived it was hard, so I had to put it in the microwave to thaw it out to make it loose and overnight it harden back up again. I've never experienced this before with this product. This product is great for my hair. I have 4C type of hair but for some reason when I ordered it from Amazon it came in hard as a rock so that's why I only gave it three stars. Typically I would have gave it five stars but I am not sure if this product was part of bad batch or what but I will reach to Amazon about it. I received my replacement order today (8/7/2020). Same issue. I will buy from the pharmacy from here on out.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Love this gel and this brand!
Review: For decades I used a spritz hair sprays that I bought at the local store. They would always leave my head itching and on fire, but then my daughter introduced me to this gel and I will never buy anything else for my hair! My hair actually goes all the way down to my lower back area and no longer is it fuzzy on the ends and split. It makes my hair stay looking natural and alive not dead. The coconut smells amazing too!  I’ve actually had people ask me what perfume or body spray I’m using and they are super surprised when I tell them that it’s my hair gel. LOL

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Not for me
Review: So the product is extremely thick you can flip the jar upside down and it will not fall out, it reminds me of coconut oil consistency you have to warm it up in your palms before putting in your hair, it is not moisturizing at all it makes my hair look oily and piecey not clumpy at all. I have 3a-3b thin hair curly. I believe this product is better for girls with 4a-4c hair we’re oils products work best. I prefer gels and this is not a gel, they should change the name.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: THEY FIXED IT!!!
Review: So, I loved this!!! I don't know why people were saying that it is like a solid, because mine was very much like how normal gel is! I think that they fixed whatever was wrong with it.Overall:Smell: OH.MY.GOD. BEST SMELL EVER!!! Paired with the SheaMoisture coconut and hibiscus curl shampoo and conditioner, this product makes my hair smell so amazing!Moisturizing: Normally my hair is really dry, but using this it was so much better, and moist, but not too moist that it's oily.Overall, I'd REALLY recommend this product to anyone with curly/wavy hair!!!! SheaMoisture is still my favorite curly-girl brand!

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Not The Same
Review: When I first used this product in 2019, it was a viscous liquid. I stopped using it almost immediately since it took nearly all day to dry.I decided to give it another shot and ordered a jar. Like many others, I got a solid, translucent block of stiff gelatin, totally unusable as it couldn't be spread in my hair. I cut up the block and ran it through the blender, rendering the product to that spreadable liquid I remember. However, a day later, it's thickening and resolidifying. If I will need to use the blender every few days, I'll be sending this poorly reformulated goop back for a refund.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Impossible to use
Review: I bought this item for my curly hair.  It is very stiff like too hard jello.  I tried several times ( once isn't enough ) to scoop some out of the jar and squish it in my palms.  I hoped the heat from my palms would soften it...It did not soften and just got broken up into little gobs.  I am stubborn and tried to get it in my hair....globs fell to the floor. I don't recommend this product

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Defective Product Widely Distributed
Review:
The media could not be loaded.
                




   Don't know what happened but went to use this and it was semi-solid and unusable.  Was more like super hard jello than anything I could put in my hair.  I did try to put some in my hand and it crumbled into little pieces.  I'm sure this jar is an outlier and have asked for a replacement.  Finger-crossed it isn't like this one.UPDATE: Received second jar and it's the same.  I went to Shea's website and discovered a number of customers writing in with the same problem.  So Shea itself is aware they have a defective product on the market.  Definitely wouldn't buy until someone at Shea can assure the problem has been fixed and bad product off shelves (though that may be difficult with Amazon sellers) The number for Shea Moisture Customer Service is 1-866-478-1925

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Disappointed
Review: The product was like a hard rubbery gel. You could not warm it up in your hands. It was so hard I actually put it in the microwave so I could use it. I was doing my hair, so I had to make it work. I'm really disappointed as an Amazon customer I put faith in the fact that I am buying from honest seller and clearly this was not the case.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Poor quality control= poor consistency
Review: I have used this product for a while now but this is the second time I have ordered and the consistency of the gel was so hard that it would be in chunks in my hair, on the floor, the counter everywhere. Last time I ordered I ended up putting it in my Vitamix with a little water, which was better but not ideal. I wrote to the company but never really got any action from them other than a form to fill out with info I had already given them when I made contact. This time I ordered hoping the previous order was just a bad batch. It came the exact same way hard and chunky. I used my immersion blender with no water and got way better consistency and results. It’s just kind of a pain to have to go through that.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: If you like hard jello
Review: The texture of this product was like a batch of jello made without enough water - very firm - too firm.  When scooped out an placed in the palm of my hand the "shuffle" crumbled like cookie crumbs. Was expecting a smooth creamy texture.  So disappointed.  Would not recommend.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: I love this product, but...
Review: I have been using this gel for the past five years so I ignored the negative reviews about the texture of the product. I wish I would have listened. The product that arrived was absolutely nothing like what I usually pick up at my local store. I ordered online for convenience, but had to go back to the store to get the product I know and love.The texture of the gel was clumpy (almost dry?!?) and impossible to evenly work through my hair. When I buy from the store it is usually thick, but usable. Over the years I have noticed differences in the texture of the product, but never anything to this extreme. Save yourself the time and money - definitely give this gel a try, but do not order online.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Wrong texture
Review: I’ve used this product multiple times throughout the years and I NEVER write bad reviews. However, this order was just awful. When I got the product It was super runny. Like fluid. There was no viscosity to it at all. But I know this product is supposed to be thicker. I saw other reviews of people getting like bricks. But I was the complete opposite. I’m not sure what’s going on with this brand lately. I did go into a store and saw a container that had the proper thickness so I know they’re at least making it right now. It was just unfortunate that my order was wrong.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Unusable due to consistency
Review: Product is unusable due to the hard jello consistency. Crumbles, does not become spreadable or liquid enough to apply to hair at all. Theory: A third party seller found these on clearance at some point and is reselling them on Amazon. Problem is, they were probably on clearance because they had been stored incorrectly, chsnging the composition of the product. I have never bought this product direct from a retailer like Target so I don't know what it is typically like, but like other reviewers, I was not able to use this product as received through Amazon.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Horrible!
Review: Shea Moisture, bring back the original formula!  I have been using this for years and what is being sold is beyond horrible!  This is not a gel.  This is not a soufflé!  It is solid and when you DIG into it, it crumbles into chunks!  I tried working and I do mean working, it in my palms, and it is useless for the hair.  When you put the clumps in your hair, you have to rub it in your hair for too long and it does not come close to the old formula.  I am sending back to Amazon, 6 jars!  This is a shame!  Oh well, we have to hunt for another product!  UGH!

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Not a product issue
Review: I have purchased this from the store before and had no issues but this jar was not right. It's a hard glob of mess that I really can't use. I'm not sure if where it was stored might've caused the glycerin to harden or what. I unfortunately have moved to an area where ethnic products are either limited or non existent so that's why I ordered this thru Amazon. It was a waste of money.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Solid gel
Review: I have used this product many times and it works great on my hair adding a more definitive hold to my curls AAAAAAND it has always been a smooth gel. THIS jar came in an almost solid jelly form. I assume it was old. Very disappointing.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Waste of money
Review: I received this product in the mail today and the product itself is so hard and stuck together like play-duh. When I tried to dig a piece out the jar it will not breakup or loosen when you rub it between the palm of your hands. I must have gotten a bad batch because this product is not usable. It is no good. Absolute waste money.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: I will never buy this again
Review: The product was clumpy upon opening. Then when I tried to apply to my hair, it rolled off my hair in lumps! So angry!! Do I put it in the microwave to un-clump it??? Totally confused!!!

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Doesn’t work as well as the kind I buy in store
Review: This products consistency is totally different than when I buy it in store. I’m not sure why. In store the product is kind of snotty and sticky, which works well for me to distribute through my hair and hold a curl. I get that that might be off putting for some, so maybe that’s why they’re changing the formula? The stuff I ordered from Amazon has the consistency of jello. You have to dig out a chunk and smoosh it into your hair and overall it just doesn’t preform as well as the old formula. Idk why it’s different, but I’ll stick to buying it from Walmart as long as it stays the snotty sticky formula I like.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: For Beard
Review: I actually use Sheamoisture Curling Gel for my beard. It has a pleasant odor, and it keeps my beard moist. My beard tends to be brittle and out of control. This product keeps my beard manageable.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Complete waste of money, product was not as advertised.

Review: Absolutely terrible. The consistency is exactly how the costumers pictures look. I didn’t read the reviews before purchasing. It’s not a gel at all it’s solid & crumbles into your hand making it useless. Do not buy online!

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: BAD
Review: I have been using this product for years. I normally buy it at a store but this time I got it online. It was solid, couldn't smooth it off, I finally got it broke some and now it just crumbles. I don't know if it got too hot and then cooled or what is wrong with this one, but I will not buy it again from online.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Great scent! Not so great keeping curls
Review: Smells good but it doesn’t seem to keep the curls. Maybe I’m not doing it right or maybe I should mix with other products but it did not keep my daughter’s curls. It was too heavy for her hair, her curls fall out with this product and makes it feel a stiff and a little sticky when it dries. Other than that, it smells great

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Possibly fake knock-off of a normally wonderful product???!
Review: I usually buy this product at Walmart but because of COVID I bought it here. It was totally different and not good at all. I cannot get it to not be solid. Usually with this product I can take a little bit of the solid and rub it in my hands and it becomes a liquid and then I can put it in my hair. The one I bought through Amazon just continues to stay solid so I can’t really put it in my hair. Is someone making a fake knock-off of this product?

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Works well but has a strange texture.
Review: I like the gel. It does the job. When I first opened it it seemed like it was dried out. I had to stir it up and have to warm I’m my hands to get rid of the chunks.It does require scrunching after it dries to make my hair appear soft but that is not that unusual.Not sure if the texture is to be expected or if I just received an old container of product.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Zero Stars Rating
Review: I have been buying this product from a local drug store but decided to just have it delivered instead. The consistency is definitely not like the real product. The original product has a liquid gel consistency what I received was stiff like jello. DO NOT BUY.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Horrible on arrival
Review: Product arrived well wrapped but when we opened the jar it was solid. Tried to stir it or breake pieces off to work into hair and it was of no use! Just awful when we really needed it. Thank God my uncle fun keys curling gel came in today and we can use that.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Watery
Review: I've had this product before and it's supposed to be a gel like bouncy consistency. This arrived watery with no bounce. The weather wasn't as hot when it arrived so I'm not blaming it on that. It seems to still do the job but I miss the jelly like feel.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Souffle it is NOTTTT... :(
Review: Bout this product for my daughter's thick curly hair bcuz I liked how the other products worked in ur hair and decided to use the gel.. worst mistake ever. Wn I opened the product the smell was AMAZING.. wn I stuck my fingers in to start to style her hair it was solid almost like dried play dough... tried warming it in my hands.. nope.. didnt work. It just clumped up and was all over the floor. Didnt stay in or on her hair.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Not the same product
Review: I never write reviews but I'm writing this one as a warning. Please don't by the product. I think it's fake. I've used this for years. It's supposed to be a workable product that does not leave a ton of residue on the hair and dries with a some hold. When I opened this it was solid rather than slick. I tried to use it and it dried sticky and greasy. I'm super disappointed because it was my back up from the last one (I bought in target) and I didn't open for a month after I bought it, so now I don't even have the option to return. Such a waste of money.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: silky hair
Review: I like how you can apply a small amount of the product to your whole head. There is a nice pleasant scent from the product along with holding moisture for the complete day. Hair is very easy to style after application of the gel while leaving a nice subtle shine.

   First one came and the consistency was off. They were very nice and immediately sent me a replacement and it was the same. Don't know why. Maybe they need to ckeck storage temperature.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: This is not a gel.
Review: I use only Shea Moisture products in my hair and have been very happy with every single one. This product was nothing like a gel. It was a clumpy solid that could not be worked into the hair in any way, shape or form. Will never buy again.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: A piece of gello that doesn’t move!
Review: It sucks! I bought it 6 months ago at the beginning I thought it was like that !! And I thought that I didn’t know how to use it!!!! I googled it and nothing was helpful ! Very hard piece of gelloToday i have a party and I searched YouTube again! Seeing old videos of people having the same product but its not like mine!!!!!In the comments i read that its an issue from the company !!!Its not my problem i want my refund or replacement immediately!What i am supposed to do with this?!

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Product not as advertised
Review: I purchased two of these product and both were dried out. The product would not come out smooth, it was more like gelatin and it would come out in tiny pieces. When I try to use it in my child's hair it broke up into much smaller pieces and it was difficult to take out of the hair. I will not be using this company again.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: "Hairs" to SheaMoisture Curling Gel Souffle!
Review: I love this product! I sort it out when looking for something to maintain the texture and add sheen to my daughter's (3) hair and it grows, and couldn't be more happy.  I founded on YouTube and a demonstration buy a parent on her child's hair and it was highly recommended.Combine with the maker's shampoo and the conditioner, we finally develop a cleanse and beauty routine that keeps her hair as healthy as possible.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Read reviews before you purchase
Review: I wish I would have read the reviews before I bought this product! LOL! This product is so not good for your curls. The clumps are hard and they get stuck on your hair. This is not gel. This is jello!

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: New formula? Fail.
Review: Same as the other reviews. Complete waste. It clumps like very firm jello and just falls off your hands and your hair. Ends up making a mess in the sink and on the floor.Go back to your original formula please!

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: No longer a fan of SheaMoisture
Review: like all the other reviewers, I found this product unusable for the same reasons....it was exactly the same consistency as someone else posted - jello like that crumbled upon touch.  So disappointed, usually really like this company will now be looking at others...

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Just microwave it !!
Review: Ok ladies!!! This product is the best I’ve used for my hair but they CHANGED THE FORMULA! Now this product is clumpy and hard to use... UNLESS YOU PUT THE PRODUCT IN THE MICROWAVE FOR 30 seconds! I’ve been using it for years and have never needed to do this until the new formula change. Still works the same. JUST MICROWAVE IT!!! It took me two tossed out containers to realize this! Hope it helps!

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: The consistency of this gel is absolutely not suitable for use.
Review: I have been using this gel for a very long time, and such a bad experience for the first time. The gel is lumpy and does not dissolve in the hands at all, even if you add water. I will definitely return it.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Clumpy Hard Gel
Review: This product was hard and chunky.  I tried to rub the product between my hands to get it soften and liquify, but that did not help.  I bought 2 jars early quarentine and now the return window is closed and I am stuck with unusable product.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Great product, but..disappointed with this Jar..
Review: I have been using the souffle product for a few years.  However, when I received this jar the consistency was very firm and not as liquid as those previously purchased.  i am not sure if this due to perhaps this a bad batch or if this was a very old jar..  Either way, I love the Shea Moisture Souffle and will hopefully not receive another jar is this condition.  I was firm, moreso than the somewhat jelly like consistency....very hard (I had to microwave it just to get it in a more liquid form)will not order it again from this seller.

Review: it was old. it was hard as a brick, i didn't use it immediately but, after 3 weeks, I opened it to use.. I have used (prior)  jars of product for more than 2 years, and I have never had a jar to get hard as a rock.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz

Review: I bought a few of these and they were all the same. Totally different from purchasing in the store. It did not have the same consistency. It was clumpy and would not melt in the hand like the ones I have purchased in stores. I recommend not purchasing it here, I don't know if it is shipping or the temperature they were stored in. Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: Good stuff
Review: Oh I love this stuff. Let me tell you made my own flax seed gel at home and this was just like it only a lil better. Moisture and definition on point.

Product: Sheamoisture Curling Gel Souffle for Thick, Curly Hair Coconut and Hibiscus to Moisturize and Protect Hair 12 oz
Title: BUYER BEWARE. EITHER DEFECTIVE (both ones I received) OR COUNTERFEIT PRODUCT.
Review: Buyer beware. This must be a counterfeit product bc it is not correct. It’s a solid block not a gel. I’ve used this before and it’s supposed to be an actual gel. This is not useable at all.
