Product: Shea Moisture Skin Care, Coconut & Hibiscus Illuminating Hand and Body Scrub, Gluten Free Vitamin E, Restores Radiant Healthy Glow to Dull Skin, 2 jars - 12 oz ea.
Title: Pure Body scrub! Real Salt, Real Moisturizer for delicate skin
Review: Shea Moisture Coconut & Hibiscus Hand & Body Scrub is AMAZING!It's been at least 15 years since I've found a real salt scrub with moisturizer in it - and I've spent serious money on other products that said they did the same but fell way short.I tend to break out in rashes due to stress and when using this, it didn't irritate my skin while I let it soak in after scrubbing it all over my body, even my face, neck and ears. After gently drying off, my skin wasn't too slippery or slick, it had soaked the moisturizer to just the right level.Since I have delicate skin especially coming out of winter this is perfect and know it will be the same in summer after working outside.If you have any type of skin issues I highly recommend Shea Moisture Coconut & Hibiscus Hand & Body Scrub. I did order and wash with the Shea Moisture Face and Body Bar (African Black Soap) first and my skin is healing and feels smooth without flaking or itching.My Granddaughter could use this so I'm going to order for her as well, the ingredients are pure so not worried about either one of us having a reaction.Cannot recommend this enough!

Product: Shea Moisture Skin Care, Coconut & Hibiscus Illuminating Hand and Body Scrub, Gluten Free Vitamin E, Restores Radiant Healthy Glow to Dull Skin, 2 jars - 12 oz ea.
Title: Best purchase ever!
Review: Best body scrub ever! I have had a lot of body scrubs that have too much olive oil and it makes the shower slimy. This one is kinda dry until you wet it. It leaves just the right amount of moisture on you, so you don’t feel like an oil slick. The smell is wonderful! My daughter loves it too, so I’ve already ordered more. It’s been one of my favorite Amazon purchases.

Product: Shea Moisture Skin Care, Coconut & Hibiscus Illuminating Hand and Body Scrub, Gluten Free Vitamin E, Restores Radiant Healthy Glow to Dull Skin, 2 jars - 12 oz ea.
Title: Nope
Review: Makes me nauseous (subjective).  Objectively this does not exfoliate- this shouldn’t be called a scrub.  This doesn’t even moisturize, it coats your skin and rubs off on every fabric and piece of furniture you own.  I would just go back to exfoliating with baking soda and moisturizing with coconut oil.  Its smells like and feels like cheap candle wax.

Product: Shea Moisture Skin Care, Coconut & Hibiscus Illuminating Hand and Body Scrub, Gluten Free Vitamin E, Restores Radiant Healthy Glow to Dull Skin, 2 jars - 12 oz ea.
Title: Can’t stand the smell.
Review: I’m not sure this product is authentic. My roommate got some from Walgreens and it smelled great, contained a lot of oil in the mixture and was extremely moisturizing. This stuff smells awful, and feels like it only moisturizes about 1/4th as much as the one from Walgreens did. The whole product consistency and scent seems off. I’m really regretting using this in the shower because now it’s all I can smell and want to vomit. I don’t even know how to explain the scent other than gross. It’s kind of a chemical smell like how some clothes or other items off Amazon smell sometimes. I seriously feel like I’m going to have to soak myself in tomato juice like they do to get skunk smell out just to get this nauseating scent out of my skin.

Product: Shea Moisture Skin Care, Coconut & Hibiscus Illuminating Hand and Body Scrub, Gluten Free Vitamin E, Restores Radiant Healthy Glow to Dull Skin, 2 jars - 12 oz ea.
Title: Very rough on the skin, dries out quickly
Review: Shocked this gets such good reviews. It is way too rough and I don't think I have particularly sensitive skin. Particles are way too big and feels uncomfortable. Did not hydrate my legs at all and after one use it was too dry to use even though the lid was shut very tight. I had to add jojoba oil to it to use it. Would not buy again.

Product: Shea Moisture Coconut & Hibiscus Dead Sea Salt Muscle Relief Mineral Soak for Unisex, 20 Ounce
Title: smells bad (like really fake) and has stuff other than salt in it
Review: it smells nothing like coconut and hibiscus, and trust me i'm not sensitive at all to smells but this is the 2nd shea moisture product ive used and i cant say either product i bought i was happy with at all (the other is that coconut lotion that literally does not come out of the bottle). i love strong smells usually but this smells... off. and i don't like it, it smells very synthetic and gross. the other issue is that idk what else is in here besides salt but there are little brown pieces that i dont like floating around the bathtub, looks like rocks or something, i dont know but it made me like the product less too. probably wont be buying another shea moisture product, i dont get the hype. im sticking to l'occitane, dr. teal's, and kneipp bath products.

Product: Shea Moisture Coconut & Hibiscus Dead Sea Salt Muscle Relief Mineral Soak for Unisex, 20 Ounce
Title: Best scent possible!! A MUST try for regular bath takers! But a bit pricey..
Review: This smells AMAZING!! It's a floral, fresh scent that just melts into the hot bath. Ultra moisturizing! On my 1st use, I immediately thought that all of my friends and family, the fellow bath taker ones, ABSOLUTELY NEED to try this!!... I thought of buying more to give as presents but it's kinda of expensive for a small/ medium sized jar. A bit pricey but the story of the history is nicely written on the product. I am definitely going to buy more.. but only when I want to splurge on myself and I'm trying to make my jar last as long as possible. LOVE THIS!! Please make it a little cheaper so I can buy more on the regular. Favorite new bath time soak!! Smells amazing, feels amazing, immediate results!!

Title: Had to chisel to loosen up the salts
Review: I am giving this product a 3 because it is the average of my experience so far with this product; would give a 2.5 if I could but rounding up versus down because I love the scent and feel in the bath. My daughter gave me my first jar for Mothers Day and I loved it so much I ordered another when I used it up. However I opened the jar last night and was surprised to see that the salts were hard and I had to chisel at it to loosen up some to put in the bath. When trying to insert a knife down through I meet resistence which tells me I will need to continue to chisel away every time I use it. In contrast I had no issue with just scooping in with my hand and grabbing some from the first jar (or the other one I bought at the same time as this one in the Lavendar & Wild Orchis scent). I do know the two scents were sent from two locations so don't know if that had something to do with it. So be aware that there may be inconsistency with the quality of this product which has been my experience so far out of two jars.

It's a good smell, just really strong so maybe start off with less bath salt than the norm if you have a sensitive nose. It definitely helped relax sore muscles better than regular Epsom and my skin is so smooth right now!
